snippet: John Kerry, who had hoped for the position when President Obama was first elected in 2008, would likely win a large number of Republican votes for confirmation.
abstract: Pres Obama is said to be leaning strongly toward naming Massachusetts Sen John Kerry to succeed Hillary Rodham Clinton as secretary of state; Kerry, who had hoped for position when president was first elected in 2008, will likely pass through confirmation with no problems.
lead_paragraph: John Kerry, who had hoped for the position when President Obama was first elected in 2008, would likely win a large number of Republican votes for confirmation.

headline.seo: Obama Expected to Name Kerry as Secretary of State
headline.main: Obama Expected to Name Kerry as Secretary of State
headline.print_headline: With Rice Out, President Is Expected to Name Kerry as Secretary of State
